course.subject: IELM
course.name: Ergonomics and Safety Management
course.description: Introduction to ergonomics and safety management.  Work environment stressors and their reduction.  Technical compliance of Occupational Safety and Health Ordinance and their respective laws in UK, EC, and US.  Accident causation models.

reviews.author: VCJ
reviews.comment_content:
Compulsory course for IEEM students, an elective course for Design/ Technology Management minor.
Topic 1: Introduction to Ergonomics
Topic 2: Environment design I - Noise at work
Topic 3: Six-Sigma approach on Safety Management
============ (Mid-term cutoff)===========
Topic 4: Workstation design – anthropometry (This will be the key for the final examination, the else are easy topics)
Topic 5: Task design I – workload on muscle
Topic 6: Task design II – workload assessment
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. So encourages students to ask and answer questions on lecture. Nice professor and he remember name of students.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term exam: 30%
Final exam: 40% (open notes and non-cumulative, remember to print out notes for extreme case analysis (what you have done in lab 3))
Lab assignments: 25% (3 labs only)
Class & Lab Participation: 5% (3% for class and 2% for Lab, don't miss it, even emailing prof count for class participation)

A+ at the end
reviews.comment_workload: Only 3 lab sessions (with lab report) and lectures, assignments are for practice but not graded. Need fundamental statistics knowledge, print out P value table for final, and remember the formula of Var(X+Y)=Var(X)+Var(Y)+2Cov(X,Y).
